intro: Doronicum pubescens var. nemoralis, commonly known as the woolly goldcup, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces showy yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in woodland edges and moist, shaded environments, preferring well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
